abstract: Citigroup shares fell to almost 18-year lows on Thursday, with Bank of America stock also plunging, amid renewed fears that growing losses could lead to government control of troubled U.S. banks, wiping out shareholders, Reuters said.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup shares fell to almost 18-year lows on Thursday, with Bank of America stock also plunging, amid renewed fears that growing losses could lead to government control of troubled U.S. banks, wiping out shareholders, Reuters said.

headline.main: BofA And Citi Shares Fall on Nationalization Fear

abstract: New York State Attorney General Andrew Cuomo has subpoenaed Kenneth Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, as part of a probe into whether the bank withheld information from investors in violation of state law, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.
lead_paragraph: New York State Attorney General Andrew Cuomo has subpoenaed Kenneth Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, as part of a probe into whether the bank withheld information from investors in violation of state law, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Lewis Is Subpoenaed Over Merrill, Report Says

abstract: Shares of Citigroup and Bank of America crashed through their previous 52-week lows on Friday, amid growing fears that the government might step in with a rescue plan that leaves the banks’ current shareholders with nothing.
lead_paragraph: Shares of Citigroup and Bank of America crashed through their previous 52-week lows on Friday, amid growing fears that the government might step in with a rescue plan that leaves the banks’ current shareholders with nothing.

headline.main: Shares of Big Banks Skid Lower
